alert.note: Alert for Eastern Roosevelt; Sheridan (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 5:54PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Roosevelt, southern Sheridan and northern Richland Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 554 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Medicine Lake to Froid to 8 miles east of Brockton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Culbertson, Medicine Lake, Bainville, Froid, Mccabe, Dagmar, Fort Kipp and Homestead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
